text: Python: Is it possible to have multiple exceptions statments for a try block?

code:
try:
    case_no  = re.search("Case Number:</span></td><td><span class=\"Value\">([^<]*?)<",br.response().read()).group(1)
except:
       try:
           try:
               case_no  = re.search("Citation Number:</span></td><td><span class=\"Value\">([^<]*?)<",br.response().read()).group(1)
            except:
               case_no  = re.search("Citation Number:</span></td><td><span class=\"Value\">([^<]*?)<",br.response().read()).group(1)
        except:
              case_no  = "N/A"

text: As you can see the above code is quite clumsy.
I want to know if there is any way I can do like this.

code:
try:
    XYZ
except:
    DOXYZ
except:
    DOXYZ

text: Basically I want to be able to use - "try X if exception then try Y if exception then try Z" without nesting too much statemtns.
